abstracts.cdata!:
The Poverty Reduction Fund Project aims
            at developing the institutional and operational framework
            for a social fund model, and pilot its ability to increase
            access to, and provide quality of basic social and economic
            infrastructure, and services, among St. Lucia's
            vulnerable poor. The project will thus contribute to a
            sustainable infrastructure, fostering community-led
            development. The project components include: 1)
            institutional strengthening for poverty reduction, to
            further increase the role and responsibilities of
            communities in the subproject cycle development, including
            subproject management, and strengthening promotion
            mechanisms. This component will include the establishment of
            appropriate methodologies and criteria of the subproject
            cycle, in accordance with all relevant parties involved in
            poverty reduction; 2) subproject financing, which will
            mobilize external co-financing, with possible support from
            other agencies, such as the Caribbean Development Bank and
            the European Union. Subproject implementation will include
            social and economic infrastructure, technical assistance and
            capacity-building for social assistance programs; 3) project
            management costs, to cover the execution of the design
            phase, and implementation, as well as monitoring and evaluation.
